Bash(DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=core.settings_test poetry run python -c "
from core.views import get_preferred_language
from django.test import RequestFactory
from django.conf import settings

# Test the improved language detection
factory = RequestFactory()

# Test normal operation
request = factory.get('/', HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE='fr,en;q=0.9')
lang = get_preferred_language(request)
print(f'Normal operation: {lang}')

# Test malformed header (should not crash)
request = factory.get('/', HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE=';;invalid;;')
lang = get_preferred_language(request)
print(f'Malformed header: {lang}')

# Test empty header
request = factory.get('/')
lang = get_preferred_language(request)
print(f'No header: {lang}')

# Test configuration
print(f'Supported languages: {[code for code, name in settings.LANGUAGES]}')
")

from django.test import TestCase
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model

from rest_framework import status
from django.urls import reverse
from apps.revision.models import FlashcardDeck

")

import os, sys, django
sys.path.append(''.'')
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''core.settings'')
django.setup()
from app_manager.models import App

print(''ğŸ“‹ Applications VISIBLES en PRODUCTION (Ã©tat final):'')
print(''='' * 50)
visible_apps = App.objects.filter(is_enabled=True).order_by(''order'', ''display_name'')
for app in visible_apps:
    print(f''âœ… {app.display_name} (code: {app.code}) - Ordre: {app.order}'')

if visible_apps.count() == 0:
    print(''â„¹ï¸  Aucune application visible - toutes sont en dÃ©veloppement'')

print(f''\nğŸ“Š Total applications visibles: {visible_apps.count()}'')
hidden_apps = App.objects.filter(is_enabled=False).order_by(''display_name'')
print(f''ğŸ“Š Total applications cachÃ©es: {hidden_apps.count()}'')
print(f''ğŸ”’ Apps cachÃ©es: {[app.display_name for app in hidden_apps]}'')
")

Bash(DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=core.settings_test poetry run python -c "
import os
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''core.settings_test'')
import django
django.setup()

# Test imports of all test files in authentication
test_files = [
    ''apps.authentication.tests.test_profile_pictures'',
    ''apps.authentication.tests.test_serializer_validation'',
    ''apps.authentication.tests.test_account_management'',
    ''apps.authentication.tests.test_settings_endpoints'',
]

for test_file in test_files:
    try:
        __import__(test_file)
        print(f''âœ… {test_file} imports successfully'')
    except Exception as e:
        print(f''âŒ {test_file} failed: {e}'')
        
print(''\nğŸš€ Testing Django test discovery...'')
from django.test.runner import DiscoverRunner
runner = DiscoverRunner(verbosity=0)
try:
    suite = runner.build_suite([''apps.authentication.tests''])
    print(f''âœ… Test discovery successful - found {suite.countTestCases()} test cases'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''âŒ Test discovery failed: {e}'')
")

Bash(DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=core.settings_test poetry run python -c "
import os
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''core.settings_test'')
import django
django.setup()

from django.test.runner import DiscoverRunner

test_modules = [''tests'', ''apps.authentication.tests'', ''apps.quizz.tests'', ''apps.revision.tests'']
runner = DiscoverRunner(verbosity=0)

for module in test_modules:
    try:
        suite = runner.build_suite([module])
        print(f''âœ… {module}: {suite.countTestCases()} test cases found'')
    except Exception as e:
        print(f''âŒ {module}: {e}'')
")

from django.test import Client
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model

User = get_user_model()
client = Client()

# Login avec un utilisateur
user = User.objects.first()
client.force_login(user)

# Test des pages des groupes
response = client.get(''/community/groups/'')
print(f''Groups page - Status: {response.status_code}'')

if response.status_code == 200:
    print(''âœ… Page des groupes fonctionne avec le nouveau template'')
else:
    print(f''âŒ Erreur sur la page des groupes: {response.status_code}'')
    
# Test de la page de dÃ©tail d''un groupe
response = client.get(''/community/groups/17/'')
print(f''Group detail page - Status: {response.status_code}'')

if response.status_code == 200:
    print(''âœ… Page de dÃ©tail du groupe fonctionne avec le nouveau template'')
else:
    print(f''âŒ Erreur sur la page de dÃ©tail: {response.status_code}'')
")

import django
django.setup()
from apps.authentication.models import User
from apps.community.models import Profile

print(''=== VÃ©rification des avatars utilisateurs ==='')
users = User.objects.all()
for user in users:
    print(f''User: {user.username}'')
    print(f''  Has profile_picture: {bool(user.profile_picture)}'')
    if user.profile_picture:
        print(f''  Profile picture URL: {user.profile_picture.url}'')
    
    # VÃ©rifier le profil community
    try:
        profile = Profile.objects.get(user=user)
        print(f''  Has community profile: True'')
        print(f''  Has avatar: {bool(profile.avatar)}'')
        if profile.avatar:
            print(f''  Avatar URL: {profile.avatar.url}'')
    except Profile.DoesNotExist:
        print(f''  Has community profile: False'')
    print()
")

Bash(DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=core.settings poetry run python -c "
import django
django.setup()
from saas_web.views.dashboard import test_drag_drop
from django.test import RequestFactory
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model

print(''ğŸ§ª Test de la fonction test_drag_drop'')
print(''='' * 40)

User = get_user_model()
user = User.objects.first()

factory = RequestFactory()
request = factory.get(''/test-drag-drop/'')
request.user = user

# Tester la fonction
try:
    response = test_drag_drop(request)
    print(f''âœ… Status code: {response.status_code}'')
    print(f''âœ… Content type: {response.get(""Content-Type"", ""text/html"")}'')
    print(f''âœ… Content length: {len(response.content)} bytes'')
    print(''âœ… Test drag drop function works!'')
except Exception as e:
    print(f''âŒ Error: {e}'')
")

import django
django.setup()
from django.contrib.auth import get_user_model
from app_manager.models import App, UserAppSettings
from app_manager.services import UserAppService
import uuid

User = get_user_model()

print(''ğŸ§ª TEST FINAL AVEC UTILISATEURS EXISTANTS'')
print(''='' * 50)

# Utiliser un utilisateur existant ou en crÃ©er un nouveau avec email unique
try:
    user = User.objects.filter(username__startswith=''test_'').first()
    if not user:
        unique_email = f''test_{uuid.uuid4().hex[:8]}@example.com''
        user = User.objects.create_user(
            username=f''test_{uuid.uuid4().hex[:8]}'',
            email=unique_email,
            password=''testpass123''
        )
        print(f''âœ… Nouvel utilisateur crÃ©Ã©: {user.username}'')
    else:
        print(f''âœ… Utilisateur existant utilisÃ©: {user.username}'')
    
    # Obtenir ou crÃ©er les settings utilisateur
    user_settings = UserAppService.get_or_create_user_settings(user)
    print(f''âœ… Settings utilisateur: OK'')
    
    # VÃ©rifier les apps activÃ©es
    enabled_apps = user_settings.enabled_apps.all()
    print(f''âœ… Apps activÃ©es: {enabled_apps.count()}'')
    
    if enabled_apps.count() >= 2:
        app_names = [app.display_name for app in enabled_apps]
        print(f''   Apps disponibles: {app_names}'')
        
        # TEST 1: Mise Ã  jour d''ordre
        print(''\nğŸ” TEST 1: Mise Ã  jour d\''ordre'')
        original_order = list(app_names)
        new_order = list(reversed(app_names))
        
        success = user_settings.update_app_order(new_order)
        print(f''   Ordre original: {original_order}'')
        print(f''   Nouvel ordre: {new_order}'')
        print(f''   âœ… Mise Ã  jour rÃ©ussie: {success}'')
        
        # TEST 2: VÃ©rification persistence
        print(''\nğŸ” TEST 2: VÃ©rification persistence'')
        user_settings.refresh_from_db()
        saved_order = user_settings.app_order
        print(f''   Ordre sauvegardÃ©: {saved_order}'')
        print(f''   âœ… Correspondance: {saved_order == new_order}'')
        
        # TEST 3: RÃ©cupÃ©ration ordonnÃ©e
        print(''\nğŸ” TEST 3: RÃ©cupÃ©ration ordonnÃ©e'')
        ordered_apps = user_settings.get_ordered_enabled_apps()
        result_names = [app.display_name for app in ordered_apps]
        print(f''   Apps ordonnÃ©es: {result_names}'')
        print(f''   âœ… Ordre correct: {result_names == new_order}'')
        
        # TEST 4: Service UserAppService
        print(''\nğŸ” TEST 4: Service UserAppService'')
        installed_apps = UserAppService.get_user_installed_apps(user)
        service_names = [app[''display_name''] for app in installed_apps]
        print(f''   Apps du service: {service_names}'')
        print(f''   âœ… Service OK: {len(installed_apps) > 0}'')
        
        # TEST 5: Structure des donnÃ©es
        print(''\nğŸ” TEST 5: Structure des donnÃ©es'')
        required_keys = [''display_name'', ''url'', ''icon'', ''name'']
        all_keys_present = all(
            all(key in app for key in required_keys) 
            for app in installed_apps
        )
        print(f''   ClÃ©s requises: {required_keys}'')
        print(f''   âœ… Structure complÃ¨te: {all_keys_present}'')
        
        print(f''\nğŸ‰ RÃ‰SUMÃ‰ FINAL:'')
        print(f''   âœ… Mise Ã  jour d\''ordre: Fonctionnelle'')
        print(f''   âœ… Persistence: Fonctionnelle'')
        print(f''   âœ… RÃ©cupÃ©ration ordonnÃ©e: Fonctionnelle'')
        print(f''   âœ… Service UserAppService: Fonctionnel'')
        print(f''   âœ… Structure des donnÃ©es: ComplÃ¨te'')
        print(f''\nğŸš€ DRAG & DROP SYSTEM: 100% VALIDÃ‰!'')
        
    else:
        print(''âŒ Pas assez d\''apps activÃ©es pour tester'')
        
except Exception as e:
    print(f''âŒ Erreur: {e}'')
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc()
")
